short_text: VC holds 3/5 board seats
full_text: The Board of Directors shall consist of five (5) members: three (3) designated by holders of Series A Preferred Stock, one (1) designated by Common Stock holders, and one (1) independent member mutually agreed upon.
explanation: VCs secure voting majority on all board decisions including CEO removal, budget approval, and strategic direction.

short_text: Founder retains 60% voting via dual-class shares
full_text: Common Stock shall be divided into Class A (10 votes per share, held by Founders) and Class B (1 vote per share). Board consists of 2 VC seats, 2 Founder seats, 1 independent. Founder maintains protective veto on CEO removal.
explanation: Founder retains control through super-voting shares, ensuring independence even with minority economic ownership.

short_text: Board parity 3-3 with rotating chair
full_text: Board consists of six (6) members: three (3) designated by Preferred holders, three (3) by Common holders. Chair rotates annually. Supermajority (5/6) required for fundamental changes including CEO removal, budget >$5M, strategic pivots.
explanation: Balanced power structure requiring consensus for major decisions, preventing unilateral control by either side.

short_text: 2x non-participating liquidation preference
full_text: Series A holders shall receive 2x their original investment before any distribution to Common stockholders. Non-participating: VCs receive 2x OR their pro-rata share of proceeds, whichever is greater.
explanation: VCs guaranteed 2x return before founders see anything, protecting downside risk but limiting upside participation.

short_text: 1x participating capped at 3x
full_text: Series A holders receive 1x original investment, then participate pro-rata with Common holders, capped at 3x total return. Beyond 3x, Common holders receive all remaining proceeds.
explanation: VCs get downside protection plus upside participation, but capped to prevent excessive extraction. Founders benefit in high-exit scenarios.

short_text: 1x non-participating, converts to pro-rata on milestones
full_text: Series A holders receive 1x preference. Upon achieving: (a) $10M ARR or (b) 50% gross margin sustained 2 quarters, preference automatically converts to pro-rata Common equivalent. VCs and founders share proceeds equally thereafter.
explanation: VCs protected in downside, but founder-friendly structure kicks in upon hitting growth milestones, aligning long-term incentives.

short_text: 4-year vest, 1-year cliff, reset on down-round
full_text: Founder shares vest over 4 years with 1-year cliff. Upon any down-round financing or CEO change, unvested shares are forfeited and new 4-year schedule begins. No acceleration on acquisition.
explanation: Strict vesting protects VCs from founder departure, but reset clause can be punitive during rough patches.

short_text: Already fully vested with single-trigger acceleration
full_text: All Founder shares are 100% vested as of Closing. In the event of acquisition or change of control, any unvested employee/advisor shares accelerate immediately (single-trigger).
explanation: Founder maintains full ownership immediately, maximum flexibility. Rare in institutional VC deals.

short_text: 4-year vest, 1-year cliff, double-trigger acceleration
full_text: Founder shares vest monthly over 4 years after 1-year cliff. Double-trigger acceleration: 50% vests on acquisition AND termination without cause within 12 months. Board retains right to extend cliff by 6 months if milestones missed, but only once.
explanation: Standard VC structure with founder-friendly acceleration protecting against acquirer misconduct.

short_text: Full IP assignment, founder indemnifies company
full_text: All intellectual property created by Founders before, during, or after employment is assigned to Company. Founders jointly and severally indemnify Company for any IP litigation arising from prior employment or third-party claims.
explanation: Maximum protection for company/VCs, but can expose founders to unlimited personal liability.

short_text: IP assigned, limited indemnification
full_text: IP created for Company is assigned to Company. Founders rep and warrant no prior conflicting obligations. Indemnification capped at 20% of Founder equity value. Company maintains D&O insurance covering IP claims.
explanation: Standard IP assignment with capped liability protecting founder personal assets.

short_text: Shared IP strategy, mutual defense
full_text: Company owns all IP. Founders and Company jointly develop patent strategy with mutual approval. Legal defense costs split 50/50 for IP litigation unless caused by Founder misconduct. Company carries IP litigation insurance with Founders as named insureds.
explanation: Balanced approach: company controls IP, but shares risk and strategy with founders.

short_text: Full ratchet anti-dilution
full_text: If Company issues shares at price lower than Series A price, Series A converts at lower price (full ratchet). VCs maintain ownership % regardless of down rounds.
explanation: Maximum protection for VCs in down rounds, but severely punishes founders and employees.

short_text: No anti-dilution protection
full_text: Series A converts at original price. No price adjustment for subsequent rounds. VCs accept dilution risk.
explanation: Extremely founder-friendly, rare in practice. VCs typically require some protection.

short_text: Broad-based weighted average
full_text: Series A conversion price adjusts using broad-based weighted average formula accounting for total outstanding shares. Excludes: (a) stock option pools, (b) convertible debt, (c) acquisitions.
explanation: Industry-standard protection balancing VC downside risk with founder fairness.

short_text: High equity stake for minimal investment
full_text: Investors receive 25% equity for $250K seed investment. Includes full ratchet anti-dilution and 1x liquidation preference. Founders retain no board control.
explanation: Early investors take significant ownership for small amounts, creating unfavorable terms for founders.

short_text: Minimal dilution with founder-friendly terms
full_text: Investors receive 10% equity for $500K seed investment. Includes broad-based weighted average anti-dilution and 0.5x liquidation preference. Founders retain 2 board seats.
explanation: Founders maintain control and minimize early dilution with favorable investment terms.

short_text: Standard seed terms with SAFE conversion
full_text: Investment via Y Combinator SAFE with 20% discount and $5M valuation cap. Converts to equity at next round. Investors get 1 board observer seat.
explanation: Industry-standard seed financing with deferred equity pricing and minimal governance rights.

short_text: Strict founder vesting with repurchase rights
full_text: All founder shares vest over 4 years with 12-month cliff. Company can repurchase unvested shares at $0.01/share upon founder departure. No acceleration provisions.
explanation: VCs protect against founder departure with strict vesting and repurchase rights.

short_text: Founder-controlled vesting with full acceleration
full_text: Founder shares fully vested immediately. Double-trigger acceleration: 100% vests on acquisition AND involuntary termination. Board cannot modify without founder consent.
explanation: Founders maintain full control over their equity with maximum protection against dilution.

short_text: Standard founder vesting with single acceleration
full_text: Founder shares vest monthly over 4 years with 12-month cliff. Single-trigger acceleration on acquisition. Company can repurchase at fair market value.
explanation: Balanced approach protecting both founder commitment and company interests.

short_text: Aggressive VC terms with full control
full_text: VCs receive 40% ownership at $10M pre-money. 3/5 board seats, full ratchet anti-dilution, 2x liquidation preference. Pro-rata rights and information rights.
explanation: VCs secure maximum control and downside protection in Series A round.

short_text: Founder-friendly Series A with retained control
full_text: VCs receive 20% ownership at $30M pre-money. 2/7 board seats, no anti-dilution, 1x liquidation preference. Founders retain majority voting control.
explanation: Founders maintain significant control and minimize dilution in Series A financing.

short_text: Balanced Series A terms with standard protections
full_text: VCs receive 25% ownership at $20M pre-money. 2/5 board seats, broad-based weighted average anti-dilution, 1.5x liquidation preference. Standard investor rights.
explanation: Industry-standard Series A terms balancing founder control with investor protection.

short_text: Full IP assignment with unlimited indemnification
full_text: Founders assign all IP created before, during, and after employment. Unlimited indemnification for any IP claims. Company owns all derivative works.
explanation: Maximum IP protection for company, exposing founders to unlimited liability.

short_text: Limited IP assignment with founder protections
full_text: Company owns IP created for company projects. Founders retain personal IP rights. Indemnification capped at founder equity value. No retroactive assignment.
explanation: Founders maintain significant IP rights and limit liability exposure.

short_text: Standard IP assignment with reasonable protections
full_text: Company owns IP created during employment using company resources. Founders retain pre-existing IP. Indemnification capped at 2x founder compensation. Reasonable assignment scope.
explanation: Balanced IP ownership protecting both company interests and founder rights.

short_text: Comprehensive investor protections
full_text: Full information rights, board observation, pro-rata rights, co-sale rights, and unlimited audit rights. Investors can demand CEO replacement with 60% approval.
explanation: Maximum investor control and monitoring rights, minimizing founder autonomy.

short_text: Minimal investor rights
full_text: Basic information rights only. No board observation, no pro-rata rights, no co-sale rights. Investors must go through formal board process for any demands.
explanation: Founders maintain maximum control with minimal investor interference.

short_text: Standard investor rights package
full_text: Quarterly information rights, 1 board observer, pro-rata rights for 12 months, co-sale rights. Standard governance protections with founder veto on major decisions.
explanation: Balanced investor rights allowing monitoring while preserving founder control.

short_text: Strict content moderation with founder liability
full_text: Company must implement AI content moderation. Founders personally indemnify for any user-generated content claims. Unlimited liability for platform misuse.
explanation: Maximum liability protection for investors, exposing founders to unlimited risk.

short_text: Minimal content restrictions with company liability
full_text: Open platform with user content freedom. Company assumes all liability for user actions. Founders have no personal indemnification obligations.
explanation: Founders maintain platform vision with company bearing all liability risks.

short_text: Balanced content policies with shared liability
full_text: Reasonable content guidelines with human moderation. Liability capped at insurance coverage limits. Founders indemnify only for gross negligence.
explanation: Balanced approach sharing liability while maintaining platform utility.

short_text: VC-controlled acquisition with earn-outs
full_text: VCs control acquisition decisions. Founder earn-outs based on 3-year retention. VCs receive 80% of proceeds before founder distributions.
explanation: VCs maximize liquidity while minimizing founder payout through complex earn-out structures.

short_text: Founder-controlled acquisition with immediate payouts
full_text: Founders control acquisition decisions. Full payout on closing with no earn-outs. Founders receive 60% of proceeds before investor distributions.
explanation: Founders maximize immediate liquidity and control over acquisition process.

short_text: Balanced acquisition with milestone earn-outs
full_text: Board approves acquisition decisions. Earn-outs based on 2-year retention milestones. Equal distribution of proceeds after preferences.
explanation: Balanced approach aligning founder and investor interests through milestone-based compensation.

short_text: VC-majority board with founder removal rights
full_text: VCs appoint 4/7 board members. Can remove CEO/founders with 60% vote. Board can override founder decisions on strategic matters.
explanation: VCs maintain complete board control with ability to remove founder leadership.

short_text: Founder-controlled board with VC veto only
full_text: Founders appoint 4/7 board members. VCs have veto on financial decisions only. Founders cannot be removed without unanimous board consent.
explanation: Founders maintain operational control with limited VC oversight.

short_text: Balanced board with deadlock resolution
full_text: 3 founder seats, 3 VC seats, 1 independent chair. Deadlock resolved by independent director. CEO removal requires 5/7 approval.
explanation: Balanced governance with clear deadlock resolution and mutual veto rights.

short_text: Professional management with founder oversight limited
full_text: VCs can hire professional CEO. Founders limited to product roles. Board controls all hiring decisions above $200K compensation.
explanation: VCs ensure professional management replaces founder control during scaling.

short_text: Founder retains CEO role with advisory board
full_text: Founder remains CEO indefinitely. VCs appoint advisory board only. Company culture decisions remain with founder team.
explanation: Founders maintain complete operational control during scaling phase.

short_text: Phased transition to professional management
full_text: Founder CEO for 18 months, then performance review. Professional CEO hired if metrics not met. Balanced board controls key hires.
explanation: Structured transition allowing founder control initially with professional oversight as company scales.

short_text: Aggressive IP litigation with founder funding
full_text: Company must pursue all IP infringements aggressively. Founders personally fund litigation costs. Unlimited indemnification for IP claims.
explanation: Maximum IP protection with founders bearing all litigation costs and risks.

short_text: Defensive IP strategy with company funding
full_text: Company focuses on defensive patents only. All litigation costs borne by company. Founders have no personal indemnification obligations.
explanation: Conservative IP approach protecting founder assets while maintaining competitive position.

short_text: Balanced IP strategy with insurance coverage
full_text: Strategic patent portfolio with selective litigation. IP litigation insurance covers costs. Founders indemnify only for willful infringement.
explanation: Balanced approach using insurance to manage IP litigation risks while maintaining competitive protection.

short_text: Strict milestone requirements with clawbacks
full_text: Funding released only upon hitting exact KPIs. Missed milestones result in equity clawbacks. Investors can terminate funding at will.
explanation: Maximum investor control over funding with severe penalties for missing milestones.

short_text: Flexible milestones with full funding upfront
full_text: Full funding provided upfront. Milestones are advisory only. Founders have discretion to adjust product roadmap without investor approval.
explanation: Founders maintain complete control over product development with guaranteed funding.

short_text: Structured milestones with reasonable flexibility
full_text: Funding tranches tied to key milestones. Reasonable adjustments allowed with board approval. Clawbacks limited to 20% of funding.
explanation: Balanced approach providing investor protection while allowing founder flexibility.

short_text: Market-rate executive pay with performance bonuses
full_text: Executives receive market-rate compensation plus performance bonuses. Founder salaries capped at $200K. Board controls all compensation decisions.
explanation: Professional compensation structure minimizing founder pay while maximizing executive incentives.

short_text: Founder-controlled compensation with equity focus
full_text: Founder team determines all compensation. Heavy equity focus with minimal cash compensation. No external executive hires without founder approval.
explanation: Founders maintain control over compensation and minimize external executive costs.

short_text: Balanced compensation with board oversight
full_text: Market-competitive compensation for key roles. Mixed cash/equity packages. Compensation committee with equal founder/VC representation.
explanation: Balanced approach ensuring fair compensation while maintaining appropriate governance.

short_text: Centralized platform control with VC oversight
full_text: VCs control platform governance decisions. Strict content policies enforced. Founders must comply with all VC directives on platform operations.
explanation: VCs maintain complete control over platform direction and operations.

short_text: Decentralized platform with founder vision
full_text: Founders control platform governance. Open platform philosophy maintained. VCs have advisory role only on business decisions.
explanation: Founders maintain complete control over platform vision and operations.

short_text: Collaborative governance with user focus
full_text: Balanced governance with user experience prioritized. Joint founder/VC decisions on major platform changes. Independent advisors for deadlock resolution.
explanation: Balanced approach focusing on platform success while maintaining appropriate governance.

short_text: VC-controlled crisis response with founder liability
full_text: VCs appoint crisis management team. Founders personally liable for crisis-related decisions. Board can remove founders during crisis without cause.
explanation: Maximum VC control during crises with founder exposure to personal liability.

short_text: Founder-led crisis response with company protection
full_text: Founders lead all crisis responses. Company bears all liability costs. VCs cannot remove founders during crisis period.
explanation: Founders maintain control during crises with company bearing all costs.

short_text: Structured crisis management with insurance
full_text: Pre-established crisis management protocols. Crisis insurance covers major costs. Joint founder/VC crisis committee with independent chair.
explanation: Balanced crisis management using insurance and protocols to protect all stakeholders.
